intro: Andinia pendens, commonly known as the hanging bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, come in shades of blue and purple, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
